# description(for:)

**Type Method**

Returns a standard role description for a user interface element.

## Declaration

```swift
static func description(for element: Any) -> String?
```

## Discussion

This function is like the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/Role/description(with:)] function, except that it queries `element` to get the role and subrole. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/Role/description(with:)] function is more efficient, but this function is useful for accessorizing base classes so that they properly handle derived classes, which may override the subrole or even the role.

## Descriptions

- **description(with:)**: Returns a standard description for a role and subrole.

items.description: Returns a standard description for a role and subrole.
